Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice with cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (partly worn) with two added white bands; exterior mostly worn; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggest that it may have come from a heavy chalice. Chalice kraters belong to the Mature Animal Style and Grand Styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1614) (phase 2)
